com.almasb.fxgl

Class GameWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.almasb.fxgl.GameWorld

  • public final class GameWorld
extends Object
    Represents pure logical state of game. Manages all entities and their state. WorldStateListener objects can be registered to listen for various state changes.
    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

      • addEntity

        public void addEntity(Entity entityToAdd)
        Places an entity in the queue to be added to the world. The entity will be added to the world in the tick.
        Parameters:
        entityToAdd - the entity to add to world

      • addEntities

        public void addEntities(Entity... entitiesToAdd)
        Places entities in the queue to be added to the world. The entities will be added to the world in the tick.
        Parameters:
        entitiesToAdd - the entities to add to world

      • removeEntity

        public void removeEntity(Entity entityToRemove)
        Places an entity in the queue to be removed from the world. The entity will be removed in the next tick.
        Parameters:
        entityToRemove - the entity to remove from world

      • removeEntities

        public void removeEntities(Entity... entitiesToRemove)
        Places entities in the queue to be removed from the world. The entities will be removed in the next tick.
        Parameters:
        entitiesToRemove - the entity to remove from world

      • getEntities

        public List<Entity> getEntities(EntityType... types)
        Returns a list of entities whose type matches given arguments. If no arguments were given, returns list of ALL entities currently registered in the scene graph.
        Parameters:
        types - entity types to select
        Returns:
        list of entities with types

      • getEntitiesFiltered

        public List<Entity> getEntitiesFiltered(Predicate<Entity> predicate)
        Returns a list of entities which are filtered by given predicate.
        Parameters:
        predicate - filter
        Returns:
        list of entities that satisfy given predicate

      • getEntitiesInRange

        public List<Entity> getEntitiesInRange(javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D selection,
                                       EntityType... types)
        Returns a list of entities whose type matches given arguments and which are partially or entirely in the specified rectangular selection. If no arguments were given, a list of all entities satisfying the requirement is returned.
        Parameters:
        selection - Rectangle2D that describes the selection box
        types - entity types
        Returns:
        list of entities in the range

      • getEntitiesByLayer

        public List<Entity> getEntitiesByLayer(RenderLayer layer,
                                       EntityType... types)
        Returns a list of entities whose type matches given arguments and which have the given render layer index If no arguments were given, a list of all entities satisfying the requirement (i.e. render layer) is returned.
        Parameters:
        layer - render layer
        types - entity types
        Returns:
        list of entities in the layer

      • getClosestEntity

        public Optional<Entity> getClosestEntity(Entity entity,
                                         EntityType... types)
        Returns the closest entity to the given entity with given type. If no types were specified, the closest entity is returned. The given entity itself is never returned.

        If there no entities satisfying the requirement, Optional.empty() is returned.

        Parameters:
        entity - selected entity
        types - entity types
        Returns:
        closest entity to selected entity with type

      • getEntityAt

        public Optional<Entity> getEntityAt(javafx.geometry.Point2D position)
        Returns an entity at given position. The position x and y must equal to entity's position x and y.

        Returns Optional.empty() if no entity was found at given position.

        Parameters:
        position - point in the world
        Returns:
        entity at point

      • fireFXGLEvent

        public void fireFXGLEvent(FXGLEvent event,
                          EntityType... types)
        Fires an FXGL event on all entities whose type matches given arguments. If types were not given, fires an FXGL event on all entities registered in the scene graph.
        Parameters:
        event - the event
        types - entity types
